alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 8:24AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern McCreary and northwestern Whitley Counties through 900 AM EDT... At 824 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Whitley City, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Duckrun and Bounty around 835 AM EDT. Krupp, Redbird and Jellico Creek around 840 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Williamsburg, Goldbug, Clio, Bon, Youngs Creek, Emlyn, Wofford, Walden, Suttons Mill, Yaden, Deering, Verne, Rockholds, Faber, Julip and Lucky. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 8 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
